column1: Then the causes of the war are summed up and the importance of the war for the industrial interests is outlined. The chief cause of the war is assigned to the irreconcilable economic conflict between the German and Russian interests created by commercial treaties favorable to Germany.Victorious Russia should dictate her own economic programme to the defeated enemy. Without such a result all sacrifices made will be in vain
column2: and will fall as a heavy and unbearable burden upon the shattered economic organization of the country.The industrial interests desire a war to the finish
column3: and they say:"Let the Government know how to cultivate in the future among the people the conviction that the war will be brought to an end
column4: then the task of finding the means for carrying on the campaign will be greatly facilitated; for no sacrifice is too great for us for the overthrow of the economic yoke of Germany and for the conquest of economic independence. Nothing but strong will and determination are needed."
